meanings.definition: The amount that a train can hold or carry.
meanings.sent1: The trainfuls of passengers eagerly boarded the train for their journey.
meanings.sent2: The cargo train was filled with trainfuls of goods bound for delivery.
meanings.sent3: The trainfuls of excited children at the station made the platform bustling with energy.
meanings.sent4: The trainfuls of memories from the trip will stay with me forever.
meanings.sent5: The trainfuls of luggage piled high on the platform, ready to be loaded onto the train.

meanings.definition: A large group or quantity of people or things.
meanings.sent1: The trainfuls of shoppers flooded the mall during the holiday sale.
meanings.sent2: There were trainfuls of books stacked in the library waiting to be borrowed.
meanings.sent3: The trainfuls of balloons at the party created a colorful spectacle in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The trainfuls of stars in the night sky twinkled like diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The trainfuls of laughter coming from the comedy show filled the theater with joy.
